meanings.definition: The act of transporting goods by road or railway.
meanings.sent1: The haulage of goods by truck is common in our town.
meanings.sent2: The company's expenses include the haulage of materials to the construction site.
meanings.sent3: I heard a joke about the haulage of penguins on a train!
meanings.sent4: The haulage of memories from the past can be a heavy burden.
meanings.sent5: The colorful trucks filled the road, a vibrant display of haulage in action.

meanings.sent1: The haulage for shipping overseas can be quite expensive.
meanings.sent2: The haulage for the delivery service was included in the final bill.
meanings.sent3: I never realized the hidden costs of haulage until I started my own business.
meanings.sent4: The haulage of goods can sometimes weigh heavily on the budget.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected increase in haulage charges caught us off guard.

meanings.definition: The amount of goods transported at one time.
meanings.sent1: The haulage of logs on the truck was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The warehouse can handle a large haulage of products at once.
meanings.sent3: The tiny cart struggled with the haulage of giant pumpkins.
meanings.sent4: The haulage of books in the library was a monumental task.
meanings.sent5: The haulage of supplies filled the room to the brim, ready for distribution.
